title: South African musician Dope St Jude's track used in trailer for new Apple TV show
text:
Cape Town – South African musician Dope St Jude's song, Grrrl Like is being featured in a promotional clip for new series, Dickinson.

The show will be featured on subscription streaming service, Apple TV+, and stars Hailee Steinfeld as famous poet Emily Dickinson.

READ NEXT: 5 things you need to know about Apple TV+ coming to South Africa.

Dope St Jude posted their reaction about the song being used in the trailer saying in part: " So my track Grrrl Like is the soundtrack to the Dickinson trailer, a show about the life of poet Emily Dickinson. I am ecstatic because she was a pretty huge deal to me as a teenager."

SEE THE TWEET HERE:

So my track Grrrl Like is the soundtrack to the Dickinson trailer, a show about the life of poet Emily Dickinson. I am ecstatic because she was a pretty huge deal to me as a teenager. S/o to my management and publishing team for being passionate about my music! ?? pic.twitter.com/9KBhyfqTqC — Catherine Saint Jude (@DopeSaintJude) October 21, 2019

The song was released in 2018, along with a video directed by the artist themselves in which they ride a motorbike next to a field of yellow flowers.

WATCH THE VIDEO HERE:
description: The new show features Hailee Steinfeld as famous poet Emily Dickinson and will debut on the international conglomerate's new streaming service.
